statement: A minimal migration can add run-level counts to run_configs, update run start + scoring/binding to read those counts, and keep experiment-level counts as fallback during transition.
rationale: Run creation already writes run_config snapshots and entrypoints can be extended; consumers can be updated incrementally.
keyAssumptions: Backwards compatibility via fallback is acceptable for existing templates/tests/UI.
validationCriteria: Tests and lab UI can be updated to supply run-level counts; no hard dependency on experiment counts remains.
critiquePoints: Dual-source counts may create ambiguity in logs and analytics.
questions: Should we fully remove counts from experiment config after migration?
